intro: Chrysosplenium alternifolium var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese liverwort, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Saururaceae. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually dark green and may have a slight bluish or silvery sheen. It is a low-growing plant that rarely exceeds a few inches in height, making it well adapted to its woodland habitat.
